title: Bluebook Short Form Citation Regex Patterns
description: Complete collection of regex patterns for validating and identifying Bluebook short form citations (Rule 4 and related rules)

id_with_pinpoint_at.note: Always include 'at' after id. when using a pincite

id_with_parenthetical_pinpoint.description: Id. citation with parenthetical pinpoint (para, p, page, §)

supra_with_author.description: Supra citation with author or source name

supra_with_title.description: Supra citation with author and short title
examples: Smith, Important Case, supra note 10, at 50
Jones, The Law Review Article, supra note 3
supra_with_title.note: Required when multiple works by same author are cited

case_name_short.description: Short form case citation by case name
case_name_short.note: Cases do NOT use supra or hereinafter. Use case name short form instead.

hereinafter_short.description: Short form using established hereinafter abbreviation
hereinafter_short.note: Use SPARINGLY. Default to supra unless confusion would result.

chapter_short.description: Short form for chapter/essay in collection (chapter author, not editor)
chapter_short.note: Use chapter author's name, not the book editor's name

service_citation_short.description: Short form for services/looseleafs with service name and paragraph
examples: CCH Cons. Fin. Guide, supra note 10
CCH Cons. Fin. Guide, supra note 10, ¶ 72,205
invalid_examples: CCH Cons. Fin. Guide supra note 10
CCH Cons. Fin. Guide, supra note 10 ¶ 72,205

foreign_source_short.description: Short form for foreign materials with optional country identifier
examples: French Penal Code, supra note 5, art. 1234
foreign_source_short.note: Include country identifier if confusion with domestic sources is likely

treaty_short.description: Short form for treaties and international agreements
examples: Convention on Human Rights, supra note 5

internet_source_short.description: Short form for internet and media sources
examples: Law & Order Blog, supra note 3, at para. 5
internet_source_short.note: For cases/statutes found online, use normal short forms

examples: Author Manuscript, supra note 3, at page 50

missing_comma_before_supra.reason: Comma required between author and supra

missing_note_keyword.reason: Must include 'note' keyword between 'supra' and number

supra_for_cases.description: Using supra for case citation (not allowed)
supra_for_cases.correct_form: Smith v. Jones (or Smith v. Jones, 100 U.S. 1, at 50)
supra_for_cases.reason: Cases do NOT use supra. Use case name short form instead.

hereinafter_for_cases.description: Using hereinafter for case citation (not allowed)
hereinafter_for_cases.reason: Cases do NOT use hereinafter. Use case name short form only.

standalone_at_pinpoint.correct_form: Id. at 100 OR Doe, supra note 5, at 100
standalone_at_pinpoint.reason: 'At' pinpoint must follow an authority reference

uppercase_supra_note.description: Supra or Note with incorrect capitalization

misplaced_comma.description: Comma incorrectly placed between supra and note
misplaced_comma.reason: Comma goes between author and supra, not between supra and note

quotes_around_author.reason: Author names should not be in quotation marks

hereinafter_without_definition.description: Using hereinafter short form without prior definition
hereinafter_without_definition.correct_form: First: ("United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea", hereinafter "UNCLOS") | Later: UNCLOS, supra note X, art. 55
hereinafter_without_definition.reason: Hereinafter abbreviation must be established in full citation first

id_with_author.description: Id. citation with author name in parenthetical
id_with_author.reason: Id. refers to preceding authority; no author name needed

word_number_pinpoint.description: Note number expressed as word instead of digit
word_number_pinpoint.reason: Note numbers must be digits only

word_pinpoint_page.description: Page number expressed as word instead of digit

rules_reference.Rule 4.1: Id. - Using the immediately preceding authority
rules_reference.Rule 4.2: Supra and Hereinafter - Using previously cited authorities
rules_reference.Rule 4.3: Id. and Footnotes - Restrictions on id. usage
rules_reference.Rule 10.9: Short Forms for Cases - Case name short forms only
rules_reference.Rule 15.10: Short Forms for Books - Author + supra format
rules_reference.Rule 15.10.1: Short Forms for Chapters - Chapter author usage
rules_reference.Rule 16.9: Short Forms for Periodicals - Author + supra
rules_reference.Rule 17.6: Short Forms for Unpublished - Author + supra
rules_reference.Rule 18.9: Short Forms for Internet - Author/title + supra
rules_reference.Rule 19.2: Short Forms for Services - Service name + supra
rules_reference.Rule 20.7: Short Forms for Foreign Materials - Jurisdiction considerations
rules_reference.Rule 21.17: Short Forms for Treaties - Treaty name + supra
